cards.flavor: For the Simic Combine, its sigil serves not as an emblem of honor but as a trademark. Its familiar image on any biological commodity attests to superb craftsmanship, ingenious innovation, and higher cost.

cards.name: Simic Sky Swallower
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"We've bred out the shortcomings of the species' natural form and replaced them with assets of our own design."
—Momir Vig

cards.name: Skullbriar, the Walking Grave
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Skullbriar, the Walking Grave deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Counters remain on Skullbriar as it moves to any zone other than a player's hand or library.

cards.name: Skullclamp
cards.flavor: The mind is a beautiful bounty encased in an annoying bone container.

cards.name: Skyscribing
cards.text:
Each player draws X cards.
Forecast — {2}{U}, Reveal Skyscribing from your hand: Each player draws a card. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

cards.name: Slipstream Eel
cards.text:
Slipstream Eel can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
Cycling {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "It's a fine way to travel, if you don't mind the smell."

cards.name: Sol Ring
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Lost to time is the artificer's art of trapping light from a distant star in a ring of purest gold.

cards.name: Solemn Simulacrum
cards.text:
When Solemn Simulacrum enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
When Solemn Simulacrum dies, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Soul Snare
cards.text: {W}, Sacrifice Soul Snare: Exile target creature that's attacking you or a planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor:
"Body and spirit are sworn enemies. They will take any excuse to be rid of each other."
—Tariel, Reckoner of Souls

cards.name: Spawnwrithe
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Spawnwrithe deals combat damage to a player, put a token that's a copy of Spawnwrithe onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Its victims feel only an itchy, wriggling feeling just under their skin. By then, it's far too late.

cards.name: Spell Crumple
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on the bottom of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard. Put Spell Crumple on the bottom of its owner's library.

cards.name: Spike Feeder
cards.text:
Spike Feeder enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Spitebellows
cards.text:
When Spitebellows leaves the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to target creature.
Evoke {1}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
cards.flavor: Disaster stalks with gaping jaws across unready lands.

cards.name: Spurnmage Advocate
cards.text: {T}: Return two target cards from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.flavor: "Our unity humbles our foes."

cards.name: Squallmonger
cards.text: {2}: Squallmonger deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.flavor: "Squall, gale, hurricane—it's all a matter of size . . . and price."

cards.name: Stitch Together
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Threshold — Return that card from your graveyard to the battlefield instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

cards.name: Storm Herd
cards.text: Put X 1/1 white Pegasus creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield, where X is your life total.
cards.flavor:
"When you hear thunder on a cloudless day, take cover and brace for the coming of the storm herd."
—Skotov, Tin Street basket vendor

cards.name: Stranglehold
cards.text:
Your opponents can't search libraries.
If an opponent would begin an extra turn, that player skips that turn instead.
cards.flavor: The correct answer to a barbarian's riddle is to choke on your cleverness and die.

cards.name: Sulfurous Blast
cards.text: Sulfurous Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player. If you cast this spell during your main phase, Sulfurous Blast deals 3 damage to each creature and each player instead.
cards.flavor: The Keldons used the toxic vents in the cracked earth to bolster their home's defenses.

cards.name: Svogthos, the Restless Tomb
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}{B}{G}: Until end of turn, Svogthos, the Restless Tomb becomes a black and green Plant Zombie creature with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard." It's still a land.

cards.name: Symbiotic Wurm
cards.text: When Symbiotic Wurm dies, put seven 1/1 green Insect creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The insects keep the wurm's hide free from parasites. In return, the wurm doesn't eat the insects.

cards.name: Syphon Flesh
cards.text: Each other player sacrifices a creature. You put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield for each creature sacrificed this way.
cards.flavor: Necromancers deal in commodities far more precious than gold and grain.

cards.name: Syphon Mind
cards.text: Each other player discards a card. You draw a card for each card discarded this way.
cards.flavor: When tempers run high, it's easy to lose your head.

cards.name: Szadek, Lord of Secrets
cards.text:
Flying
If Szadek, Lord of Secrets would deal combat damage to a player, instead put that many +1/+1 counters on Szadek and that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Tariel, Reckoner of Souls
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
{T}: Choose a creature card at random from target opponent's graveyard. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor:
"After death you face paradise, damnation, or Tariel."
—Priest's teaching

cards.name: Temple of the False God
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control five or more lands.
cards.flavor: Those who bring nothing to the temple take nothing away.

cards.name: Teneb, the Harvester
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Teneb, the Harvester deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Terminate
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"I've seen death before. My mother succumbing to illness, my comrades bleeding on the battlefield . . . But I'd never seen anything as dreadful as that."
—Taani, berserker of Etlan

cards.name: Terramorphic Expanse
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Take two steps north into the unsettled future, south into the unquiet past, east into the present day, or west into the great unknown.

cards.name: The Mimeoplasm
cards.text: As The Mimeoplasm enters the battlefield, you may exile two creature cards from graveyards. If you do, it enters the battlefield as a copy of one of those cards with a number of additional +1/+1 counters on it equal to the power of the other card.

cards.name: Trade Secrets
cards.text: Target opponent draws two cards, then you draw up to four cards. That opponent may repeat this process as many times as he or she chooses.

cards.name: Tranquil Thicket
cards.text:
Tranquil Thicket enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Cycling {G} ({G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Trench Gorger
cards.text:
Trample
When Trench Gorger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for any number of land cards, exile them, then shuffle your library. If you do, Trench Gorger has base power and base toughness each equal to the number of cards exiled this way.

cards.name: Tribute to the Wild
cards.text: Each opponent sacrifices an artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"You may enter, but leave those lifeless things of your world behind."
—Modruni, maro-sorcerer

cards.name: Triskelavus
cards.text:
Flying
Triskelavus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelavus: Put a 1/1 colorless Triskelavite artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

cards.name: Troll Ascetic
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.
cards.flavor: It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.

cards.name: Unnerve
cards.text: Each opponent discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"If fear is the only tool you have left, then you'll never control me."
—Xantcha, to Gix

cards.name: Valley Rannet
cards.text: Mountaincycling {2}, forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain or Forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Vampire Nighthawk
cards.text:
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Vedalken Plotter
cards.text: When Vedalken Plotter enters the battlefield, exchange control of target land you control and target land an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "Fair? At what point in our negotiations did you convince yourself my goal was to be fair?"

cards.name: Vengeful Rebirth
cards.text:
Return target card from your graveyard to your hand. If you return a nonland card to your hand this way, Vengeful Rebirth deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to target creature or player.
Exile Vengeful Rebirth.

cards.name: Veteran Explorer
cards.text: When Veteran Explorer dies, each player may search his or her library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

cards.name: Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter
cards.text:
Flying, lifelink
Sacrifice a creature: Put X +1/+1 counters on Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
Remove all +1/+1 counters from Vish Kal: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each +1/+1 counter removed this way.

cards.name: Vision Skeins
cards.text: Each player draws two cards.
cards.flavor: "I could see in the other mage's eyes that he'd thought of it too. Then it became a race to exploit the knowledge first."

cards.name: Vivid Crag
cards.text:
Vivid Crag enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Vivid Creek
cards.text:
Vivid Creek enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Creek: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Vivid Grove
cards.text:
Vivid Grove enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Grove: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Vivid Marsh
cards.text:
Vivid Marsh enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Marsh: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Vivid Meadow
cards.text:
Vivid Meadow enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Meadow: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Voice of All
cards.text:
Flying
As Voice of All enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color.

cards.name: Vorosh, the Hunter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Vorosh, the Hunter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, put six +1/+1 counters on Vorosh.

cards.name: Vow of Duty
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has vigilance, and can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor:
"I prefer loyalty to be a matter of respect, not of magic. But one does what one must."
—Kaalia of the Vast

cards.name: Vow of Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has flying, and can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor:
"Soaring is wasted on the winged."
—Edric, Spymaster of Trest

cards.name: Vow of Lightning
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has first strike, and can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor:
"Ruhan would never agree to such terms."
—Ruhan of the Fomori

cards.name: Vow of Malice
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has intimidate, and can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor:
"I grant you blades—on the condition that they are not pointed at me."
—Damia, Sage of Stone

cards.name: Vow of Wildness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3, has trample, and can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor:
"Savagery is the birthright of every creature that draws breath—or wishes it could."
—Karador, Ghost Chieftain

cards.name: Vulturous Zombie
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, put a +1/+1 counter on Vulturous Zombie.
cards.flavor:
"When something dies, all things benefit. Well okay, just our things."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

cards.name: Wall of Denial
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: It provides what every discerning mage requires—time to think.

cards.name: Wall of Omens
cards.text:
Defender
When Wall of Omens enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I search for a vision of Zendikar that does not include the Eldrazi."
—Expedition journal entry

cards.name: Whirlpool Whelm
cards.text: Clash with an opponent, then return target creature to its owner's hand. If you win, you may put that creature on top of its owner's library instead. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Wild Ricochet
cards.text: You may choose new targets for target instant or sorcery spell. Then copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: "I knew that trick long before your great-grandmother's great-grandmother was born."

cards.name: Windborn Muse
cards.text:
Flying
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.
cards.flavor:
"Her voice is justice, clear and relentless."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

cards.name: Windfall
cards.text: Each player discards his or her hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.
cards.flavor:
"To fill your mind with knowledge, we must start by emptying it."
—Barrin, master wizard

cards.name: Wonder
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.
cards.flavor:
"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
—Scroll of Beginnings

cards.name: Wrecking Ball
cards.text: Destroy target creature or land.
cards.flavor: Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.

cards.name: Wrexial, the Risen Deep
cards.text:
Islandwalk, swampwalk
Whenever Wrexial, the Risen Deep deals combat damage to a player, you may cast target instant or sorcery card from that player's graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that card would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Yavimaya Elder
cards.text:
When Yavimaya Elder dies, you may search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{2}, Sacrifice Yavimaya Elder: Draw a card.

cards.name: Zedruu the Greathearted
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life and draw X cards, where X is the number of permanents you own that your opponents control.
{R}{W}{U}: Target opponent gains control of target permanent you control.

cards.name: Zoetic Cavern
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
Morph {2} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: Nothing lives within it, yet there is life.
